metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2008 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's udmabuf device driver. The specific flaw exists within a fault handler. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a memory access past the end of an array. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of the kernel.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1085-aws - 5.4.0-1085.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1020-aws - 5.15.0-1020.24~20.04.1
No subscription required
